data.title: Reserve Forces Policy Board > Board Biographies > lord
data.text:
Major General Walter T. Lord is the Military Executive, Reserve Forces Policy Board, Office of the Secretary of Defense, Washington, DC. The Reserve Forces Policy Board serves as an independent adviser to the Secretary of Defense, providing advice and recommendations to the Secretary on strategies, policies, and practices designed to improve and enhance the capabilities, efficiency and effectiveness of the Reserve components. He was recommended by the chair and designated by the Secretary of Defense, serving as both the military adviser to the chair and as military executive officer for the Reserve Forces Policy Board. He also supervises the operations and staff of the Board.

He was most recently a Special Assistant to the Vice Chief, National Guard Bureau. His primary responsibility was to orchestrate the National Guard Bureau effort in contributing to the Secretary of Defense's 2014 Quadrennial Defense Review. In leading the National Guard Bureau QDR team, he represented the NGB Chief and Vice Chief and conveyed the National Guard's position at meetings and working sessions with key leaders in the Department of Defense, Joint Staff, Military Services, and the Army and Air National Guard.

General Lord was commissioned in 1984 through the Reserve Officer Training Corps program at Valley Forge Military Academy and Junior College. Prior to receiving his commission, General Lord enlisted in 2nd Battalion, 111th Infantry in 1982 at the age of 17. He served his initial company grade assignments with 1st Squadron, 104th Cavalry Regiment in Philadelphia.

General Lord has led at the platoon, company, squadron, and coalition headquarters levels. He has held critical army and joint staff positions at every level from unit to coalition in the Continental United States, Germany, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Afghanistan. General Lord has participated in two dual-status Joint Task Forces with United States Northern Command, serving as Chief of Staff, Joint Task Force-G20 in support of the G20 World Economic Summit in Pittsburgh, and Title 32 Deputy Commander, Joint Task Force-National Scout Jamboree in support of the 100th Anniversary National Scout Jamboree at Fort A.P. Hill, Virginia.

EDUCATION:

1986 LaSalle University, Bachelor of Arts, Criminal Justice, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 1996 United States Naval War College, Master of Arts, National Security and Strategic Studies, Newport, Rhode Island 2005 United States Army War College, by Correspondence 2005 United States Army War College, Master of Science, Strategic Studies, Carlisle, Barracks, Pennsylvania 2011 United States Northern Command/National Guard Bureau, Contingency Dual Status Commander Qualification Program, Peterson Air Force Base, Colorado 2011 George C. Marshall Center Senior Executive Seminar, Garmisch, Germany 2011 North Atlantic Treaty Organization Defense College, Generals, Flag Officers and Ambassadors Course, Rome, Italy 2014 National Defense University, CAPSTONE General and Flag Officer Course, Washington, DC 2015 Joint Forces Staff College, Advanced Joint Professional Military Education, Norfolk, VA

ASSIGNMENTS:

July 1984 - January 1985, Assistant S1, 1st Squadron, 104th Cavalry, 28th Infantry Division, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

January 1985 - October 1986, Cavalry Platoon Leader, Troop C, 1st Squadron, 104th Cavalry, 28th Infantry Division, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

October 1986 - March 1987, Tank Platoon Leader, Troop B, 1st Squadron, 104th Cavalry, 28th Infantry Division, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

March 1987 - December 1988, Executive Officer, Troop B, 1st Squadron, 104th Cavalry, 28th Infantry Division, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

December 1988 - August 1990, Executive Officer, Headquarters Troop, 1st Squadron, 104th Cavalry, 28th Infantry Division, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

August 1990 - June 1992, Assistant Professor of Military Science, Indiana University of Pennsylvania Army Reserve Officer Training Corps, Indiana, Pennsylvania

June 1992 - January 1994, Commander, Headquarters and Headquarters Company, 56th Brigade, 28th Infantry Division, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

January 1994 - July 1995, Special Actions Officer (Executive Officer), Army Logistics Directorate, National Guard Bureau, Arlington, Virginia

July 1995 - July 1996, Student, Naval Command and Staff College, Newport, Rhode Island

July 1996 - July 1998, Plans, Policy and Training Officer, United States European Command J5, Stuttgart, Germany

July 1998 - March 2000, United States Liaison Officer, North Atlantic Treaty Organization Partnership for Peace Coordination Cell & Deputy U.S. National Military Representative, Supreme Headquarters Allied Powers Europe, Mons, Belgium

March 2000 - July 2001, Regional Coordinator (European Branch Chief), International Affairs Division, National Guard Bureau, Arlington, Virginia

July 2001 - July 2002, G5, Headquarters and Headquarters Company, 28th Infantry Division, Harrisburg, Pennsylvania

July 2002 - April 2003, G5, Headquarters and Headquarters Company, 28th Infantry Division, Harrisburg, Pennsylvania and Tuzla, Bosnia and Herzegovina

April 2003 - May 2003, G1, Headquarters and Headquarters Company, 28th Infantry Division, Harrisburg, Pennsylvania

May 2003 - May 2005, Commander, 2nd Squadron, 104th Cavalry (Recon, Surveillance, and Target Acquisition), 56th Stryker Brigade, 28th Infantry Division, Reading, Pennsylvania

May 2005 - March 2006, Assistant Chief of Staff - G3, Headquarters, 28th Infantry Division, Harrisburg, Pennsylvania

March 2006 - April 2008, Chief of Staff, Pennsylvania Joint Force Headquarters, Pennsylvania Army National Guard, Annville, Pennsylvania

April 2008 - November 2008, Senior Mentor/Director, Combined Security Transition Command - Afghanistan, Afghan Senior Command and Staff College, Kabul, Afghanistan

November 2008 - June 2009, Chief, Joint Staff, Pennsylvania Joint Force Headquarters, Pennsylvania Army National Guard, Annville, Pennsylvania

June 2009 - February 2011, Deputy Commanding General-Support, 28th Infantry Division, Harrisburg, Pennsylvania

February 2011 - June 2012, Assistant Division Commander-Maneuver, 28th Infantry Division, Harrisburg, Pennsylvania

June 2012 - July 2013, Commander & Senior NATO Military Representative, NATO Headquarters Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina

July 2013 - Oct 2014 Special Assistant to the Vice Chief, National Guard Bureau, the Pentagon, Washington, District of Columbia

Oct 2014 - Present, Military Executive Officer, Reserve Forces Policy Board, Office of the Secretary of Defense, Washington, DC

Air Force Commendation Medal

National Defense Service Medal (with 1 Bronze Service Star)

Armed Forces Expeditionary Medal

Afghanistan Campaign Medal (with 1 Bronze Service Star)

Global War on Terrorism Expeditionary Medal

Global War on Terrorism Service Medal

Armed Forces Reserve Medal (with Silver Hourglass, M Device and Numeral 2)

Army Service Ribbon

Overseas Service Ribbon (with Numeral 3)

Army Reserve Components Overseas Training Ribbon (with Numeral 3)

French Commemorative Medal

European Union European Security and Defense Policy Service Medal - Althea 2nd Award

Hungarian for the Alliance Service Medal

Joint Meritorious Unit Award (with 3 Bronze Oak Leaf Clusters)
